articles.headline: Fake News Still Has a Home on Facebook
articles.snippet: Christopher Blair, a renowned “liberal troll” who posts falsehoods to Facebook, is having a banner year despite crackdowns by Facebook and growing competition from A.I.
articles.abstract: Christopher Blair, a renowned “liberal troll” who posts falsehoods to Facebook, is having a banner year despite crackdowns by Facebook and growing competition from A.I.
articles.lead_paragraph: On the morning of Jan. 6, 2021, Christopher Blair’s fake news empire was humming along.

articles.headline: Why a Gaza Cease-Fire Is So Elusive
articles.snippet: Both sides are pursuing maximalist demands, jockeying for a deal that will determine the fate of postwar Gaza — and allow them to declare victory.
articles.abstract: Both sides are pursuing maximalist demands, jockeying for a deal that will determine the fate of postwar Gaza — and allow them to declare victory.
articles.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel called Hamas’s response to the latest peace proposal for Gaza “negative.” Hamas insisted it was dealing with it “positively.”

articles.headline: A Hollywood Heavyweight Is Biden’s Secret Weapon Against Trump
articles.snippet: The longtime movie mogul Jeffrey Katzenberg always sought scary villains for his films. Now he has found what he considers a real-life one in Donald J. Trump.
articles.abstract: The longtime movie mogul Jeffrey Katzenberg always sought scary villains for his films. Now he has found what he considers a real-life one in Donald J. Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: When President Biden made clear last year that he was planning to run for another term, some important Democratic contributors expressed doubt. He was too old, they feared. He was not up to another four years.

articles.headline: Supreme Court Maintains Broad Access to Abortion Pill
articles.snippet: The decision does not eliminate efforts to restrict the availability of the pill.
articles.abstract: The decision does not eliminate efforts to restrict the availability of the pill.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court on Thursday maintained access to a widely available abortion pill, rejecting a bid from a group of anti-abortion organizations and doctors to undo the Food and Drug Administration’s approval of the drug.

articles.headline: Tesla Shareholders Approve Big Stock Package for Musk
articles.snippet: The vote was seen as a referendum on his management of the electric car maker and on the limits of executive pay.
articles.abstract: The vote was seen as a referendum on his management of the electric car maker and on the limits of executive pay.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tesla shareholders have reaffirmed a pay award of more than $45 billion for Elon Musk, the chief executive, after it was thrown out in a legal challenge.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing and Peter Eavis

articles.headline: How Baptists and the G.O.P. Took Different Paths on I.V.F.
articles.snippet: The vote at the Southern Baptist Convention raising alarms about in vitro fertilization began with two conservatives at a seminary in Kentucky.
articles.abstract: The vote at the Southern Baptist Convention raising alarms about in vitro fertilization began with two conservatives at a seminary in Kentucky.
articles.lead_paragraph: About a month after the Alabama Supreme Court ruled in February that frozen embryos were to be considered children under the law, Andrew T. Walker, an ethicist at a Southern Baptist seminary in Kentucky, called a friend with an idea: to spread Alabama’s argument beyond Alabama.

articles.headline: F.A.A. Investigating How Questionable Titanium Got Into Boeing and Airbus Jets
articles.snippet: The material, which was purchased from a little-known Chinese company, was sold with falsified documents and used in parts that went into jets from both manufacturers.
articles.abstract: The material, which was purchased from a little-known Chinese company, was sold with falsified documents and used in parts that went into jets from both manufacturers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Some recently manufactured Boeing and Airbus jets have components made from titanium that was sold using fake documentation verifying the material’s authenticity, according to a supplier for the plane makers, raising concerns about the structural integrity of those airliners.

articles.headline: Where the N.B.A. Sees Its Future
articles.snippet: The league has spent hundreds of millions of dollars to cultivate an immense potential fan base in Africa and develop future stars.
articles.abstract: The league has spent hundreds of millions of dollars to cultivate an immense potential fan base in Africa and develop future stars.
articles.lead_paragraph: On an outdoor basketball court surrounded by seashell-scattered sand last month, a man coached a group of teenage girls through a drill. The staccato pounding of their dribbles alternated in the hot air with a tinnier sound in the distance: men hammering nails into wood while a bleating white billy goat looked on.

articles.headline: Joe Biden Wants to Go Viral. It’s Not Easy.
articles.snippet: The Biden campaign is trying to work its way into social media feeds. But it is struggling to win over the young, left-leaning influencers who control the conversation online.
articles.abstract: The Biden campaign is trying to work its way into social media feeds. But it is struggling to win over the young, left-leaning influencers who control the conversation online.
articles.lead_paragraph: On a Friday afternoon in late April, President Biden brought celebrities and elite social media influencers together for a White House reception. Fran Drescher and David Cross mingled with Ilona Maher, a rugby star, and V from @underthedesknews, at a mixer meant to generate warm feelings and badly needed pro-Biden content.

articles.headline: Supreme Court Rejects Trump-Era Ban on Gun Bump Stocks
articles.snippet: The devices allow semiautomatic guns to fire more rapidly. They were banned after one of the deadliest mass shootings in modern U.S. history, at a Las Vegas concert in 2017.
articles.abstract: The devices allow semiautomatic guns to fire more rapidly. They were banned after one of the deadliest mass shootings in modern U.S. history, at a Las Vegas concert in 2017.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court on Friday struck down a ban on bump stocks, which enable semiautomatic rifles to fire at speeds rivaling those of machine guns, erasing one of the government’s rare firearm regulations to result from a mass shooting.

articles.headline: $29 Trillion: That’s How Much Debt Emerging Nations Are Facing
articles.snippet: A decades-long crisis is getting worse, and now dozens of nations are spending more on interest payments than on health care or education.
articles.abstract: A decades-long crisis is getting worse, and now dozens of nations are spending more on interest payments than on health care or education.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Vatican’s meeting on the global debt crisis last week was not quite as celebrity-studded as the one that Pope John Paul II presided over 25 years ago, when he donned sunglasses given to him by Bono, U2’s lead singer.
